revised_title: On the Comparative Effects of Urari and Strychnia on the Animal Economy
tldr: The author investigates the effects of urari and strychnia on the animal economy, finding that urari causes rapid paralysis of motor nerves, while strychnine induces tetanic spasms. Both toxins affect the heart and involuntary muscles, but urari has a more significant impact on sensory nerves and reflex activity.
